string-array.name: titles
string-array.item: A memorial stone at the birthplace of Wojciech Bogusławski in Glinno

string-array.name: descriptions_tourism1
string-array.item:
The Morasko meteorite nature reserve 
(Polish: Rezerwat przyrody meteoryt Morasko) is located in Morasko, on the northern edge of the city of Poznań, Poland. 

It contains seven meteor craters. The reserve has an area of 55 hectares (136 acres) and was established in 1976.

Wojciech Bogusławski (9 April 1757 – 23 July 1829) was a Polish actor, theater director and playwright of the Polish Enlightenment. He was the director of the National Theatre, Warsaw, (Teatr Narodowy), during three distinct periods, as well as establishing a Polish opera. He is considered the Father of Polish theatre.

string-array.name: titles_sports
string-array.item: Hall of the Communal Sports Centre

string-array.name: descriptions_sports1
string-array.item: Hall of the Communal Sports Centre is suitable for playing basketball, volleyball, team handball and indoor soccer, as well as a newly constructed building of the Culture Centre.
The complex of "Octopus" Water Park includes also a bowling alley, restaurant, as well as a fully equipped conference-business studio.
